title: About Me
text:
I am Tarun Mahesh, a second-year Master’s student at the University of Southern California, working towards a M.S. degree in Molecular Microbiology and Immunology at the Keck School of Medicine of USC.
I conduct research at Dr. David Tran’s quantitative neuro-oncology research program, where I study the immune landscape of Glioblastoma Multiforme (GBM) using a combination of computational and wet-lab analytical pipelines.
My main research interests include

Cancer Immunology
Immunotherapy Development
Cancer Neuroscience
Bench-to-Clinic Translation
Immune-editing and Immune-modulation

title: About Me
text:
Technical Skills

Molecular Biology: PCR, Plasmid Cloning, Lentiviral Transduction, DNA/Protein Purification
Protein Workflows: AKTA Chromatography, Immunoblotting, Immunoprecipitation, Protein Crystallization
Bioinformatics: R Programming, Matlab, PyMOL, AutoDock
Cell Biology and Animal Handling: Mammalian differentiated/stem cell culture, Flow-Cytometry (FACS), Mouse Stereotactic Surgery, MRI, Cryosectioning, Histology
Analytical Techniques: FTIR, UV-Vis, HPLC

title: About Me
text:
Current Projects
Decoding the Master Regulators of Lymphocyte Trafficking to the Glioblastoma Multiforme (GBM) Tumor Site
Development of an AAV gene therapy immunotherapy for the treatment of glioblastoma

text:
